title: Revenant Caves

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Revenant Caves, also known as the Forinthry Dungeon, are a set of caverns found in the Wilderness. Accessible to members only, it is an extremely dangerous cave that ranges from level 17 to 40 Wilderness and is exclusively a singles-plus combat area.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Revenant Caves
 This article has a money making guide: Looting in Revenant Caves.
Please add tips to the subpage, rather than the article below.
Revenant Caves
Released23 November 2017 (Update)
MembersYes
Floors1
LocationWilderness
InhabitantsRevenants
MusicRevenants
Map
Advanced data
Typedungeon

The Revenant Caves, also known as the Forinthry Dungeon, are a set of caverns found in the Wilderness. Accessible to members only, it is an extremely dangerous cave that ranges from level 17 to 40 Wilderness and is exclusively a singles-plus combat area.

The caves serve as a refuge for revenants. There are three entrances:

  • Level 17 Wilderness — east of the Dark Warriors' Fortress.
  • Level 26 Wilderness — north of the Bandit Camp. This is a one-way entrance.
  • Level 40 Wilderness — south-east of the Lava Maze.

Players wearing the Amulet of avarice will find that all drops from revenants will also be in noted form at the cost of being permanently skulled while it is equipped.

A dwarf multicannon cannot be placed in the caves.

Revenant Caves entrance locations

Warning: The entire area counts as the Wilderness. Players will be able to attack you here. So, only bring items you can afford to lose!

Contents

  • 1 Travel
  • 2 Features
    • 2.1 Revenants
  • 3 Changes
  • 4 Trivia

Travel[edit | edit source]

To get to the caves, players will have to traverse the Wilderness. Aside from simply walking there, there are some other options:

  • Revenant cave teleport, which teleports the player to the level 40 entrance.
  • Burning amulet, can take players to the level 17 Wilderness entrance via the Bandit Camp option, or the level 40 entrance via the Lava Maze option.
  • Wilderness Obelisks can take players to both entrances.
  • Carrallangar Teleport, or the equivalent teleport tablet, takes players to the Graveyard of Shadows, close to the level 17 entrance.
  • Canoeing to the Wilderness will take players close to the level 40 entrance.

Features[edit | edit source]

Before entering the caves, players must pay a fee of 100,000 coins. As long as the player doesn't die inside the cave, they don't need to pay the fee again. Whenever you die to a player, the 100,000 coins will be dropped as loot for the killer.

The caves are very large but only contain revenants, who are sparsely scattered throughout the caves.

There are five shortcuts around the dungeon, requiring various Agility levels to use. Boosts may be used to meet the requirement.

  • The shortcut between the revenant goblin and the southern revenant ork requires 65 Agility.
  • The shortcut west of the northern revenant ork and the shortcuts in the northwestern area require 75 Agility.
  • The shortcut between the northern revenant ork and eastern revenant pyrefiend requires 89 Agility.

Revenants[edit | edit source]

Main article: Revenants

Revenants are monsters that were slain during the God Wars. Extremely vengeful spirits, they are the main attraction of the dungeon. Revenants use all three forms of combat, using a combat style that the player is weak against as their primary attacks, and will adapt to any changes the player does. They are also capable of healing themselves when their health falls below 50%.

Revenants drop various resources, equipment and several unique items. Revenants always drop Revenant ether, which is used to charge the bracelet of ethereum. This bracelet protects the player against a revenant's attacks at the cost of 1 charge per attack. It is carried at the player's own risk, as it is always lost on death with all charges regardless of the player's item protection settings. They also drop Ancient artefacts that can be sold to the Emblem trader wandering the caves for a hefty amount of coins. Revenants also drop ancient crystals, four of which are required to build an obelisk in the Superior garden of a player-owned house. Lastly, they are able to drop weapons that are most effective if used within the Wilderness: Craw's bow, Thammaron's sceptre and Viggora's chainmace.

Killing revenants may also cause a revenant maledictus to spawn in one of several locations in the caves.

Monster Image Combat Level Quantity
Revenant imp 7 4
Revenant goblin 15 2
Revenant pyrefiend 52 4
Revenant hobgoblin 60 2
Revenant cyclops 82 2
Revenant hellhound 90 2
Revenant demon 98 4
Revenant ork 105 4
Revenant dark beast 120 2
Revenant knight 126 2
Revenant dragon 135 2
Revenant maledictus 397 Special

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
13 April 2022
(update)

The entrances are now one-way into the caves; to make up for this, players can leave the dungeon by using a one-way exit near these entrances.

22 September 2021
(update)

The entrance at level 26 Wilderness has been made one-way; players will be warned when attempting to enter from here.

21 October 2020
(update)
  • Revenant Caves overhauled - non-revenant monsters moved to the Wilderness Slayer Cave.
  • Increased amount of Revenants in the cave, and spread them over the entirety of the cave
  • Third entrance added at level 26 Wilderness.
  • 100,000 coin entry fee required to access dungeon.
  • Combat zones modified to "singles-plus" - players can still fight revenants, but they can be attacked by another player while fighting them.
  • Being skulled has less impact on drop rates
  • A dwarf multicannon can no longer be set up anywhere within the caves
  • Numerous uninteractable ghosts added across the caves
6 August 2020
(update)
  • Bracelet of Ethereum damage reduction lowered by 25% for a total of 75% damage reduction.
  • The average value of the revenant drop table been reduced by around 20%.
6 December 2018
(update)

Players are now prevented from spamming the entrance/exit to the Revenant caves to avoid PKers.

1 March 2018
(update)
  • The magic attack of the Revenants will now target several players at once. Up to 10 players stood on the same tile as the main target will be targeted with the magic attack.
  • The chances of rolling on the normal loot table have been increased slightly.
21 February 2018
(update)
  • Reduced overall value of revenant drops
  • Dwarf multicannons can no longer be placed within the Revenant area of the caves
26 January 2018
(update)
  • Increased the likelihood of landing on the normal loot table instead of coins.
  • Removed some lesser valuable drops and increased quantities of regular loot.
  • Tweaked various weightings across the normal loot table and all 100x drops have been removed.
  • Added Ancient Statuettes to the drop table.
30 November 2017
(update)
  • Revenants now correctly play their correct defend animations.
  • The Slayer gem will now log kills of Revenants.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Revenants were originally the replacement for player killers between 11 December 2007 and 1 February 2011 in what has become known now as RuneScape. They could attack players depending on their combat level and depth in the Wilderness (just as PKers can today) as well as heal themselves, teleblock and freeze players.

The '''Revenant Caves''', also known as the '''Forinthry Dungeon''', are a set of caverns found in the [[Wilderness]]. Accessible to [[members]] only, it is an extremely dangerous cave that ranges from level 17 to 40 Wilderness and is exclusively a [[singles-plus combat]] area.

The caves serve as a refuge for [[revenants]]. There are three entrances:
* Level 17 Wilderness — east of the [[Dark Warriors' Fortress]].
* Level 26 Wilderness — north of the [[Bandit Camp (Wilderness)|Bandit Camp]]. This is a '''one-way''' entrance.
* Level 40 Wilderness — south-east of the [[Lava Maze]].

Players wearing the [[Amulet of avarice]] will find that all drops from revenants will also be in noted form at the cost of being permanently [[Skull (status)|skulled]] while it is equipped.

A [[dwarf multicannon]] cannot be placed in the caves.

[[File:Revenant Caves location.png|thumb|left|200px|Revenant Caves entrance locations]]
'''{{Colour|red|Warning}}:''' The entire area counts as the Wilderness. Players will be able to attack you here. So, only bring items you can afford to lose!

==Travel==
To get to the caves, players will have to traverse the [[Wilderness]]. Aside from simply walking there, there are some other options:
*[[Revenant cave teleport]], which teleports the player to the level 40 entrance.
*[[Burning amulet]], can take players to the level 17 Wilderness entrance via the [[Bandit Camp (Wilderness)|Bandit Camp]] option, or the level 40 entrance via the [[Lava Maze]] option.
*[[Wilderness Obelisk]]s can take players to both entrances.
*[[Carrallangar Teleport]], or the [[Carrallangar teleport|equivalent teleport tablet]], takes players to the [[Graveyard of Shadows]], close to the level 17 entrance.
*[[Canoeing]] to the Wilderness will take players close to the level 40 entrance.

==Features==
Before entering the caves, players must pay a fee of 100,000 coins. As long as the player doesn't die inside the cave, they don't need to pay the fee again. Whenever you die to a player, the 100,000 coins will be dropped as loot for the killer.

The caves are very large but only contain [[revenants]], who are sparsely scattered throughout the caves.

There are five [[shortcuts]] around the dungeon, requiring various [[Agility]] levels to use. Boosts may be used to meet the requirement.

*The shortcut between the revenant goblin and the southern revenant ork requires 65 Agility.
*The shortcut west of the northern revenant ork and the shortcuts in the northwestern area require 75 Agility.
*The shortcut between the northern revenant ork and eastern revenant pyrefiend requires 89 Agility.

===Revenants===
{{Main|Revenants}}
[[Revenants]] are monsters that were slain during the [[God Wars]]. Extremely vengeful spirits, they are the main attraction of the dungeon. Revenants use all three forms of combat, using a [[combat style]] that the player is weak against as their primary attacks, and will adapt to any changes the player does. They are also capable of healing themselves when their health falls below 50%.

Revenants drop various resources, equipment and several unique items. Revenants always drop [[Revenant ether]], which is used to charge the [[bracelet of ethereum]]. This bracelet protects the player against a revenant's attacks at the cost of 1 charge per attack. It is carried at the player's own risk, as it is always lost on death with all charges regardless of the player's item protection settings. They also drop [[Ancient artefacts]] that can be sold to the [[Emblem trader]] wandering the caves for a hefty amount of coins. Revenants also drop [[ancient crystal]]s, four of which are required to build an [[Obelisk (Construction)|obelisk]] in the [[Superior garden]] of a [[player-owned house]]. Lastly, they are able to drop weapons that are most effective if used within the Wilderness: [[Craw's bow]], [[Thammaron's sceptre]] and [[Viggora's chainmace]].

Killing revenants may also cause a [[revenant maledictus]] to spawn in one of several locations in the caves.

==Trivia==
*Revenants were originally the replacement for [[player killers]] between [[11 December]] [[2007]] and [[1 February]] [[2011]] in what has become known now as ''{{RSL|RuneScape}}''. They could attack players depending on their [[combat level]] and depth in the [[Wilderness]] (just as PKers can today) as well as heal themselves, [[teleblock]] and freeze players.
